meaning: स्हे अप्पेअर्स् इन् थे फ़ोर्म् ओफ़् थे वरिओउस् स्मृतिस्। (She appears in the form of the various smṛtis.)
commentary:
स्मृति (Smṛti) means ‘to recollect’. स्मृतिस् (Smṛtis) are the detailed explanations of ideas contained in the Vedas and help us recollect them. Smritis stem out of the authoritative dictates contained in the Vedas. They teach us the way or life, duties and many more aspects.

Manu Smriti, Yagnavalkya smriti are two examples of Smritis.
